newsitem.title: MEXICO: GFesa says to raise capital stock.
newsitem.headline: GFesa says to raise capital stock.

text.p: Mexican publishing company Grupo Fernandez Editores (Gfesa) shareholders have approved an increase in shareholding equity of 54,219,701 shares at a price of 2.30 pesos each, a Mexican stock market statement said on Monday.

The statement said shareholders at an annual assembly held on Friday voted to cancel 35,000 Series B shares to create the new C shares, which will have limited voting rights and be either redeemable or convertible to B class shares.
The C class shares will be sold to BT International Delaware, a subsidiary of Bankers Trust Corp., which said last month it will acquire a minority stake in Gfesa.
The Bankers Trust subsidiary will purchase 107.1 million pesos worth of the new Series C shares for a temporary stake in Gfesa, the company said.

GFesa B shares bucked a general downward trend on the Mexican stock market to stand up one centavo at 1.70 pesos at mid-morning trade on Monday. The opening minutes of the session saw a cross trade of 3.6 million GFesa B class shares.
